Broker

The Democrats halting the vote on Estrada will bite them hard in '04. As many of you probably know, Hispanics are now the largest minority in the US. Many of them are angry that the Democrats are blocking Estrada. 
 
 I'm surprised... they aren't pandering for votes in the Hispanic community. Who else do they pander to by blocking Estrada...
Debater
They just don't want a conservative as a judge.
Broker
Not only that, but also this guy is on his way to the Supreme Court.
Debater

Yeah, and they don't want a conservative S.Ct. Justice.
 
 The want their own liberal "justices"
dsadevil

Conservative (or liberal for that matter) doesnot = justice. Of course democrats want a liberal on the court. That isn't unreasonable. I am willing to concede that intelligent conservatives are on the court (Scalia jumps to mind). I disagree with him, but he's still smart. Estrada I don't know about, because bush refuses to release the documents that tell us his judicial philosophy. If i am a senator, I dont put a judge on the court for life without knowing what his judicial philosophy is.
Broker

Same thing happened with someone Clinton nominated.
 
 The position is that they aren't going to give an opinion because their job is to interpret law and they don't want to have a position unless they have heard both sides of a case or something to that extent.
dsadevil

Saying that Estrada "doesn't have opinions" is insane. Everyone has opinions, and we need to know what they are. But even beyond that, we don't even have an idea of his judicial philosophy. Is he a federal govt. person or is he strong on states rights? Activist or Restrained? How much deference does he believe the court should give to superior courts and other equal courts? All these questions need to be answered, or at least have insight given in to them.
 
 And, if you please, name the Clinton appointee and the court he was being appointed to.
Broker

I was watching the Senate on C-SPAN at around 11:00... I'll try go find the name. 
 
 The Clinton nominee got through without giving some of these opinions. He said he would base his rulings on what he heard and what the law said, not what he thought. That was good enough. He got through with 55 votes... the Republicans could have blocked him easily. 
 
 The Republicans are still playing this very well. They're taking vote, after vote, after vote putting all these Democrats on the record. Next election maybe the Hispanic voters will help get our Senators out of office...
dsadevil

Its nice that they are putting this all on the record. When Republicans are faced with an embaressing bill they dont want to go on the record against, they don't even let it come up for a vote (see the Obey/Thomas proposal).
 
 We'll see what the hispanics do. I don't think this is a make or break issue, especially considering that the national hispanic organizations oppose Estrada.
Broker

Daschle blocked votes on 12 very important bills when he was majority leader. 
 
 Organizations... most organizations have a bias. I don't see many individuals opposing Estrada... I see them complaining about the Democrats not letting him have a floor vote.
dsadevil

And I see most people opposing him. It kinda depends on your perspective.
 
 Daschle has done obstructionist things too. But let's not be all self-rightous and say the republicans have been perfectly even handed either.
Broker
I'm not, I'm just saying that they do it too... possibly more and on more important issues. No... I can't back that up...

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Estrada Blunder Will Hurt In '04
